content: bamboo field mitts materials yarn any sport weight yarn will work the sample uses rowan felted tweed in the colorway herb 150 yards will be more than enough to make these mitts to pattern i used approximately 122 yards to make the sample finished sizes women s medium approximately 7 inches long from top to bottom approximately 7 inches around unstretched the mitt will stretch to fit up to 9 5 inches around top of cuff gauge 6 5 stitches = 1 inch in bamboo rib stretched slightly needles size 2 us 2 75mm or size to obtain correct gauge you may use either dpns or circulars knitter s choice glossary k = knit p = purl pm = place marker sm = slip marker cuff cast on 48 stitches preferably by casting on over two needles held together or another stretchy cast-on may be used i used the long-tail method divide the stitches between needles evenly join to knit in the round without twisting and begin bamboo rib pattern you will repeat the chart four times around the circumference of the mitt repeat these 12 rounds twice more three times in total 36 rounds you will begin the thumb gusset on your next round gusset m1r = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from back to front knit this loop m1l = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from front to back knit through the back of the loop m1p = bring the tip of the left-hand needle under the strand between stitches from back to front purl this loop note you will be increasing in the center of the gusset for this construction as opposed to the outsides as a traditional thumb gusset round 1 knit in bamboo rib pattern round 1 for 22 stitches pm m1p k2 m1p pm knit remaining stitches of round in bamboo rib pattern as established 4 stitches between markers
